Defending your time consists of three things:

1. Deciding how you use your time

**Step 1.** 
The easiest of the three. What do you want to do? What are your goals, hobbies, projects, things you need to take care of? People you want to see? Write them down, prioritize them by importance.

A few years ago I deactivated Facebook to simply break the habit of logging in to it as the first thing I did when I turned on my computer. This was the first step and I realized some anxiety went away after a few days of not being drawn into it. Also I made time for more meaningful things in my life. Last year I deleted my data and account all together.
